com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.

This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
This attack does 20 damage times the amount of {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Discard the top 3 cards of your deck.
Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 more damage for each heads.
Attach up to 3 {R} Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 60 damage for each heads.
Put 3 {N} Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This Pokémon can’t attack during your next turn.
Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your {N} Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
This attack does 20 more damage for each {W} Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those cards into your deck.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
You may discard any Stadium card in play.

Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Search your deck for up to 2 {R} Energy cards and attach them to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
You may attach up to 5 {R} Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack does 120 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Discard an Energy from this Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned. It can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
This attack does 20 more damage times the amount of {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Discard any amount of {R} Energy from your Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage for each card you discarded in this way.
Discard all basic {P} Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

You can use this attack only if the total of both players’ remaining Prize cards is 6 or less. Put 6 damage counters on each of your opponent’s Pokémon. (You can’t use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 20 damage for each basic Energy card in your discard pile. Then, shuffle those cards into your deck.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Paralyzed. (You can't use more than 1 GX attack in a game.)
If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 80 more damage.
This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.
This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 60 more damage.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may discard the top 5 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are {R} Energy cards, attach them to this Pokémon.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on each of your Benched Pokémon.
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may discard a {W} Energy card from your hand.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to your {N} Pokémon. (Existing effects are not removed.)
Your Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost, except Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.
If this Pokémon has any basic Energy attached to it, it takes 20 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Your {N} Pokémon's attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a {R} Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Your Wishiwashi-GX in play get +20 HP, and their attacks do 20 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Your {W} Pokémon can't be Confused. If those Pokémon are already Confused, remove that Special Condition.
Whenever you attach an Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, remove all Special Conditions from it.
This Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon for each of their Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX in play.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).
As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a {W} Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 3 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, discard your other Benched Pokémon.
You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.\n\nDraw 2 cards for each {R} Pokémon you have in play.
If the {N} Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 3 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.
You can play this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand.\n\nSearch your deck for up to 4 {R} Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.\n\nSearch your deck for up to 2 {N} Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.
Switch your Active {W} Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, heal 30 damage from the Pokémon you moved to your Bench.
Whenever a player flips a coin for the Special Condition Burned between turns, that Special Condition isn't removed even if the result is heads.
You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.\n\nAttach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your {N} Pokémon.

product.dm.booster.11card.name: Dragon Majesty
product.dm.booster.6card.name: Dragon Majesty
product.dm.booster.generic.sell-text: Noble Pokémon of wing and claw, flying high above the changing world! The Pokémon TCG: Dragon Majesty expansion brings a mighty horde of draconic Pokémon: Reshiram-GX, Salamence-GX, Dragonite-GX, and over a dozen more, including Charizard! Their command of fire, battle, and sky puts Dragon types at the top of many Trainers’ lists—get to know these amazing and challenging Pokémon in the Dragon Majesty expansion!

specialvisualizations.dm_41.brighttone: This Pokémon is immune to damage done by attacks from Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.
specialvisualizations.dm_44.dragonlift: This player's Pokémon in play have no Retreat Cost, except Pokémon-GX and Pokémon-EX.
